page.title: 07ST.MARY'S CHURCH, NONINGTON.
page.content: On Friday we went to the church in Nonington.The vicar Mr. Hawkins took us. First of all we saw the font. This is where people are christened. The font is as near as the door as possible as this is a symbol of entering the Church. Next we sat on some pews, then we went on to the organ where Mr. Hawkins played some notes for us.In the vestry we saw where the vicar changes into his robes. Also in the vestry are the bell ropes and we all had a pull and made the bells ring. Then we saw a kind of goblet, it is called a chalice and it dates back to the time of Queen Elizabeth 1. Outside in the churchyard is a memorial to all those people who died in the two World Wars.
